sections.title: About
sections.text:
Fimagri is an Organization of Producers born to valorize its associates’ land products.

It was born in 2004 due to a group of farmers, enthusiastic about their work, who shared the idea of making a healthy agriculture.

The main goal of our organization is to produce in harmony with nature, hence, we choose only partners that manage their companies with legality and frankness, and that cultivate their land opting for good agricultural procedures complying with environment and safety of human beings.

sections.title: Quality
sections.text: Fimagri works hard to reach high quality standards, in accordance with the environment, the food safety and the workers’ safety.

sections.title: Our Treasure: the Territory
sections.text:
Fimagri associates more than 60 agricultural companies that have productive sites along all Apulia’s northern plane, the “Tavoliere delle Puglie”; from the light terrains and full of minerals next to Lesina and Varano Lakes, to the fertile lands downline of the Daunian Mountains.

Our treasure really is this territory, which boasts uniques pedoclimatic conditions for vegetables plantations.

sections.title: Our Goals: Sustainability, Food Safety, Innovation
sections.text:
All Fimagri associates are gathered by:

  • Passion for agricultural work
  • Strong bond with the territory
  • Experience and specific Proficiency
  • Continuous technical Research and Innovation

    • These element allow Fimagri to offer product s obtained with the best agricultural procedures done complying with ethical, environmental, and food safety procedures.

sections.title: Our Strength: Collaboration ...
sections.text:
Fimagri believes in the value of co-operation, seen as entrepreneurial spirit.

The strength f co-operation allows agricultural companies to maintain their identity and, at the same time, to participate in a common management to reach ambitious challenges, such as export, markets, and ecological, digital and social transition.

In order to reach those goals, Fimagri implemented a productive process open up to innovations for sustainable development and exploitation of its associates’ productions.

sections.title: ... and Team Play
sections.text: Equipped with a qualified technical-agronomic staff, Fimagri follows its farmers in all production steps, giving birth to a constant and reliable team play.

sections.title: Certified Quality
sections.text: To guarantee high quality standards, Fimagri, subscribed to “Quality Agricultural Work Network”, choose to certify its product Global G.A.P. G.R.A.S.P. module, NURTURE Module, LEAF Marque: voluntary certification systems based on guidelines intended to enhance all the aspects of the productive process, particularly concentrating on human beings safety, environment, and workers welfare.

sections.title: Food Safety
sections.text:
All productive processes are designed, implemented and controlled to guarantee to the consumer a safe and healthy product.

It’s always possible to define Fimagri’s product origin thanks to an accurate and widespread traceability system, based on precise identification of the single agricultural productive units, shortening more and more the distance between consumer and producer.

sections.title: Sustainability, Research and Innovation
sections.text:
Fimagri’s main goal is the respect of the nature.

All the associated agricultural companies share production processes, implemented and organized by Fimagri, for the realization of a healthy agriculture that protect the land and its worth.

In this context, Fimagri is active in innovative research projects supporting a rural agricultural development in tune with the territory and with the optimization of the available resources.

Thanks to the experience of our farmers, the specific expertise of the technical-agronomic team, and the support from technology, Fimagri works daily for the achievement of the following goals:

  • Rationalise the use of phytosanitary products for the defence of the cultivations, favouring the us of control means with low impact, and increasing the organic productive surfaces
  • Manage the “Water resource” in a responsible and rational manner, with the use of irrigation methods with high efficiency in function of the needs of the cultivation
  • Manage in a sustainable way the “soil resource”, adopting good agricultural processes and innovative techniques that protect the organic substance and the biodiversity
  • Rationalise the plastic consume in the productive processes with the use of reusable packing cases

sections.title: Green asparagus
sections.text:
Fimagri green asparagus is cultivated in light terrains of Tavoliere plains.

Distinguished by a slim shape and a brilliant colour, our asparagus is appreciated for its sweet but strong flavour.

Harvested during the day and in the right moment, the Fimagri green asparagus is cooled instantly to guarantee a better shelf life of the product.

After an accurate selection, Fimagri works on its asparagus in personalized packaging, diversified for calibre and weight, to satisfy needs of every type of customer.

For the product distribution, Fimagri uses an organized and careful logistics, to guarantee a continuous cold chain to deliver the final consumer fresh asparagus, as quickly as possible.

The Fimagri green asparagus is available from February to June.

sections.title: Spinach
sections.text:
Cultivated in full field, in conveniently drained soil, the spinach occupies a relevant spot among Fimagri’s productions.

Fimagri spinach, also in baby leaf size, shows up strong and with an intense green colour.

The harvesting is done with innovative machines that allows a first selection already in the field.

Later, the just harvested spinach, reaches the Fimagri processing site where, through optic selectors and manual controls, another selection is done based on high quality standards.

Fimagri spinach, following the “plastic free” principles, is packed in reusable cases, immediately refrigerated and sent to the several national and European destinations with refrigerated vehicles meant to maintain the cool chain.

Fimagri spinach is cultivated according to the organic and integrated cultivation method and is available from October to April.

sections.title: Artichoke
sections.text:
The artichoke produced by Fimagri farms is green, round shaped and with a tender heart.

Supported by sunny weather, the Fimagri artichoke has vigorous plants and fleshy fruits with a mild taste, particularly suitable for the best preserves and the fresh market.

The Fimagri artichoke is cultivated with the method of integrated and biological production and it’s available from February to May. Commercial characteristics of the product and packaging can vary, depending on the customers’ demand.

sections.title: Broccoli cabbage
sections.text:
The broccoli cabbage grown by Fimagri farms is earmarked for fresh market and is cultivated with the method of integrated and biological production.

The Fimagri broccoli cabbage is available from October to April and the packaging can vary, depending on the customers’ demand.

sections.title: Tomato
sections.text:
Fimagri was born as an organization of tomato’s producers, aiming at the aggregation of farms that for more than 50 years have been devoted to the cultivation of this precious vegetable, appreciated all over the world.

Grown in the sunny plaines of Tavoliere, the red tomato cultivated in Apulia is characterized by a sweet taste, an intense flavour and a solid and substantial pulp, suitable for transformation for private and industrial canned food.

The experience and the professionality of producer members allowed Fimagri to affirm itself as a serious and qualified organization and ensured it business relations with brand leaders of its sector.

Aided by a highly qualified technical staff that cooperates with the world of scientific research, Fimagri takes care of every phase of the production process from choosing seeds, planted in trusty nursery of associated companies, to collecting and delivering the product.

The Fimagri tomato is cultivated with the method of integrated and biological production and it’s available from July to October.
